availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: James Artus was born on July 3, 1789 in Kentucky. He enlisted in the Army in August of 1812 in Maysville and was discharged in February of 1813. He fought in the Battle of Lake Erie. In 1850 he was an insurance agent in Maysville, Mason County, Kentucky. In 1860 he was a farmer in the same city. He died on April 16, 1866 in Maysville, Mason County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, Maysville District 1, p. 95; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, p. 155; Application for Pension, 1855, James Artus, War of 1812, https://www.fold3.com/image/322215728/?terms=James%20Artus; Edwin Porter Thompson, A Young People’s History of Kentucky for Schools and General Reading (St. Louis: A. R. Fleming Publishing Company, 1897), 197. John M. Trowbridge, “’To Meet the Men at Any Element:’ The Kentucky Militia in the Battle of Lake Erie,” Kentucky Ancestors: Genealogical Quarterly of the Kentucky Historical Society 42, no. 1 (2006): 4.
